New Records: South Africa bowled the most overs of spin in a T20 World Cup match
Key Match Events: Marco Jansen hit the winning six
Kagiso Rabada and Marco Jansen took it home for South Africa
Roston Chase's 3 for 12 and Joseph's 2 for 25 kept South Africa on tenterhooks
Heinrich Klaasen provided the game-changing passage of play with 29 runs
Pre-Game Insights: Aiden Markram emphasized South Africa's focus on spin bowling
South Africa were looking to overcome pressure and find ways to win games they should be losing
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa captain Aiden Markram praised the team's tenacity and ability to scrap for wins
West Indies will look to their batting as the major reason they were unable to advance
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was affected by rain, reducing the game to 16.1 overs per side
South Africa will likely avoid India in the final four
This was South Africa's first T20 World Cup knockout appearance in a decade
